alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 6:16AM EDT until April 05 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Wilcox, Dodge and Telfair Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Pulaski and Bleckley Counties. Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Wheeler, Treutlen and Montgomery Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Abbeville, Hawkinsville... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Mount Vernon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Mount Vernon. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19 feet, Minor flooding expands further into the woodlands and pastures upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 280. The boat ramp parking lot is flooded out on the Wheeler County side of the river. More homes on Dead River Road in the south part of Montgomery County become surrounded with water. Some flooding inside the structures is possible. Some portions of Dead River Road are covered by at least a foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 18.6 feet and slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 11.4 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
